db:abstract.db:para: The QSequentialIterable::const_iterator allows iteration over a container in a QVariant.
This struct was introduced in Qt 5.2.

db:section.db:title: Detailed Description
db:section.db:para: A QSequentialIterable::const_iterator can only be created by a QSequentialIterable instance, and can be used in a way similar to other stl-style iterators.

db:section.db:title: const_iterator::const_iterator(const QSequentialIterable::const_iterator &other)
db:section.db:para: Creates a copy of other.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] const_iterator::~const_iterator()
db:section.db:para: Destroys the QSequentialIterable::const_iterator.

db:section.db:title: bool const_iterator::operator!=(const QSequentialIterable::const_iterator &other) const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if other points to a different item than this iterator; otherwise returns false.

db:section.db:title: const QVariant const_iterator::operator*() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the current item, converted to a QVariant.

db:section.db:title: QSequentialIterable::const_iterator const_iterator::operator+(int j) const
db:section.db:para: Returns an iterator to the item at j positions forward from this iterator.

db:section.db:title: QSequentialIterable::const_iterator &const_iterator::operator++()
db:section.db:para: The prefix ++ operator (++it) advances the iterator to the next item in the container and returns an iterator to the new current item.
Calling this function on QSequentialIterable::end() leads to undefined results.

db:section.db:title: QSequentialIterable::const_iterator const_iterator::operator++(int)
db:section.db:para: This is an overloaded function.
The postfix ++ operator (it++) advances the iterator to the next item in the container and returns an iterator to the previously current item.

db:section.db:title: QSequentialIterable::const_iterator &const_iterator::operator+=(int j)
db:section.db:para: Advances the iterator by j items.

db:section.db:title: QSequentialIterable::const_iterator const_iterator::operator-(int j) const
db:section.db:para: Returns an iterator to the item at j positions backward from this iterator.
If the container in the QVariant does not support bi-directional iteration, calling this function leads to undefined results.

db:section.db:title: QSequentialIterable::const_iterator &const_iterator::operator--()
db:section.db:para: The prefix – operator (--it) makes the preceding item current and returns an iterator to the new current item.
Calling this function on QSequentialIterable::begin() leads to undefined results.
If the container in the QVariant does not support bi-directional iteration, calling this function leads to undefined results.

db:section.db:title: QSequentialIterable::const_iterator const_iterator::operator--(int)
db:section.db:para: This is an overloaded function.
The postfix – operator (it--) makes the preceding item current and returns an iterator to the previously current item.
If the container in the QVariant does not support bi-directional iteration, calling this function leads to undefined results.

db:section.db:title: QSequentialIterable::const_iterator &const_iterator::operator-=(int j)
db:section.db:para: Makes the iterator go back by j items.
If the container in the QVariant does not support bi-directional iteration, calling this function leads to undefined results.

db:section.db:title: QSequentialIterable::const_iterator &const_iterator::operator=(const QSequentialIterable::const_iterator &other)
db:section.db:para: Assigns other to this.

db:section.db:title: bool const_iterator::operator==(const QSequentialIterable::const_iterator &other) const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if other points to the same item as this iterator; otherwise returns false.
